File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Camp\Campfire_Moments\GLO_OathbreakerKnight_FirstAppearance.lsj
Synopsis:
When a paladin breaks their oath for the first time, a mysterious knight will appearto them in a vision. They will speak briefly to the player, hinting that the breaking of their oath requires further discussion in camp.

0:0 - At the close of day, I will be waiting for you.
uid: 04cf4c16-2cf2-4157-870f-226ab793737a
Animation: [DAN] PlayerStaggers
Cinematic: The player looks for the speaker, and sees a knight in imposing armour holding their sword, strange turquoise vapours flickering and stirring around them.
> We have much to discuss.

0:0 - You have broken your oath, paladin.
uid: 56a0bb92-b396-7117-6f8f-4a5ef08a7070
Animation: [DAN] PlayerStaggers
Cinematic: When the flash clears, the player finds themselves in the oathbreaker dimension, a strange voidspace thick with strange fogs and unnatural turquoise light. A voice calls to them...
> At the close of day, I will be waiting for you.

0:0 - At the day's end, we must speak again.
uid: a58f1868-e161-b608-bca4-7d8f345b17c3

0:0 - *Something shifts within you once more, paladin. You feel an emptiness within you, a void where your purpose used to lie.*
uid: ce6a0fb3-00bb-bb0c-b4d5-a17db3b125dc
Animation: [DAN] *DUPE* PlayerStaggers
Cinematic: The player staggers, hand clutched to their chest. The glow builds once more as they close their eyes against... A FLASH of light. They are in the oathbreaker dimension once more, the Oathbreaker NPC stood before them holding their sword.
> At the day's end, we must speak again.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch1_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Camp\Campfire_Moments\CAMP_Shadowheart_IVB_CFM_LaezelFight.lsj
Synopsis:
(Note 1: this scene can play out from the perspective of Shadowheart, Lae'zel or a third avatar. (Note 2: this scene features a time transition of a couple of hours. The first part takes place at camp in the evening before everyone retires. The second part occurs later the same night after everyone seemingly is asleep). (Note 3: for much of this scene after the time transition, either Shadowheart or Lae'zel is lying on the ground, being held at knife point by the other) A conflict between Shadowheart and Lae'zel comes to a head when Lae'zel learns Shadowheart has a gith artefact, She demands an explanation, but almost certainly doesn't receive one. Later, during the night, one of the two is awoken by the other, who holds them at knifepoint (this could be Shadowheart seeking to get rid of Lae'zel or Lae'zel demanding answers from Shadowheart). Things could turn violent, with one possibly killing the other and other party members possibly getting involved. Or they could bury the hatchet.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch0_Hotfix2_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Camp\Campfire_Moments\CAMP_Shadowheart_IVB_CFM_Box.lsj
Synopsis:
Shadowheart examines the mysterious puzzle box that she's been closely guarding. She has a mission to deliver this item to her cloister in Baldur's Gate, though doesn't truly know what it is. She tries to understand it, and possibly draws the attention of one of her companions - she shuts them down when they ask her about it, however. Note: a version this scene may have already occurred in the Druid Grove - this is a fallback that occurs at the party's campsite.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Camp\Campfire_Moments\CAMP_Shadowheart_CFM_Ultimatum.lsj
Synopsis:
Shadowheart appears at the player's campsite one night after they missed all other opportunites to recruit her in their party. She seems unhinged, paranoid - convinced that we intend to steal something important that she possesses. We may learn that the item she refers to is the mysterious cube - a sentient gith artefact that's manipulating her into appearing to us and forcing a confrontation. The cube contains the long-imprisoned spirit of a gith general, who wants to fall into our party's hands in an effort to eventually break free. He's forcing Shadowheart to either join the party or get killed by the party - either way, the cube will be where it wants to be.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Camp\Campfire_Moments\CAMP_OwlbearCub_CFM_Dog.lsj
Synopsis:
The player hears an uproar in the camp and think the owlbear’s turned on Scratch. When they investigate, they discover the cub is having a nightmare and the dog is comforting him. The player can talk to them and confirm that there's no danger. Subsequently, the cub will be a permanent feature in the camp, with new behaviours with Scratch, plus a new default dialogue. Note: if the player decides to not investigate the sounds, the animals will be moved off-stage for the remainder of the night/the sounds will stop, The player won't know what happened until they see the animals again. If they have SwA, they can learn that there was nothing wrong.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Camp\Campfire_Moments\CAMP_InfernalBox_IVB_CFM_BoxAppears.lsj
Synopsis:

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Camp\Campfire_Moments\CAMP_GoblinHuntCelebration_SD_SelectNight.lsj
Synopsis:
When player chooses to sleep after goblin hunt celebration, this narration dialogue occurs. If Minthara does not have a partner, she will attempt to talk with an avatar who hasn't refused her directly. Note: the player might be meeting up with Lae'zel or Astarion for a second time after sleeping with them before in the past. The reflection moments are for characters who the player may have already done the romance for, who don't have a romance tied to the overnight (only Wyll), or who don't have a second romance scene available overnight if you did the first (anyone other than Laezel and Astarion).

0:0 - *The buzz of celebration quiets to a soothing hum as you approach your bunk.*
uid: 0d935fbc-86c6-876f-4222-928f1c09457d
> *Your hand was sought by several, but there is only one night ahead.*
> *Though you seek repose, you needn't spend the night alone.*
> *You've picked up a few pleasant memories on your journey, amongst your struggles.*

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Camp\Campfire_Moments\CAMP_GoblinHuntCelebration_SD_ROM_NightWithDrow.lsj
Synopsis:
After the goblin hunt celebration party, the Drow Commander Minthara has made arrangements to get intimate with the player at night. After the sex scene, Minthara becomes troubled. She realises that while she's with the player she cannot hear the voice of the Absolute... which is liberating, and disturbing. This, unknown to her, is because of the Astral Prism's influence.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch0_Hotfix3_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Camp\Campfire_Moments\CAMP_GoblinHuntCelebration_SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion.lsj
Synopsis:
After the goblin hunt celebration party (whether the player helped the goblins or the tieflings), Astarion has made arrangements to get intimate with the player at night. For Astarion, this is a game of power - one he's played many times before in the taverns of Baldur's Gate, trying to lure people back to his master. He's an old hand at seduction, very self-assured at first, but the player might not go along with the script he expects them to follow. The next morning, the player wakes to see Astarion standing and getting dressed. They catch a glimpse of scars on his back - a sore point. The scars were carved into him by his old master. As far as Astarion knows, they're a poem, but he's never been able to read it (can't look in a mirror, after all).

Synopsis:
Minthara ambushes a player during the night, standing over them with a knife. This can occur almost immediately after sleeping with her, in which case she regrets what she is about to do, and can be convinced not to go through with it.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Camp\Campfire_Moments\CAMP_Gale_CRD_SpellTeaching.lsj
Synopsis:
In this scene, Gale is conjuring an image of Mystra over the palm of his hand, staring at the goddess he’s love with, but who abandoned him. When the player approaches, he dispels the image and he feels embarrassed to have been caught doing what he was doing. The conversation turns to his passion for magic however, and he invites the player to try to cast a spell with him together. The player can do so by passing through various stages of spell casting, and when successful, this can lead to a first player-initiated romantic moment with Gale.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch1_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Camp\Campfire_Moments\GLO_Elminster_CFM_GaleCom.lsj
Synopsis:
Gale is a Companion. This dialogue can trigger as COM (if the players approach Elminster with Gale as a companion), as a regular dialogue (if the players approach Elminster while Companion Gale is in the camp) or a CFM (if the player skips Elminster altogether). It can trigger in either Creche or SCL.

0:0 - Mmm, yes, what a delightful wedge of Old Elturian that was. Doesn't do to parley on an empty stomach, you know. Makes one's words frivolous when they should be grave.
uid: 00481cac-df83-41fe-ae44-299fa53328b9
> null

0:0 - Why, some bread, cheese, and a cup of wine would appear unto me a feast! Surely you won't begrudge me a mite of rest and repast before I get 'out with it'?
uid: 03b1a8b7-570a-4b22-8cdc-90357e6b2d4a
> Yes, Gale. Where is your decorum?
> Surely you could have conjured any feast you liked.
> I suppose we could part with a few of our rations.
> I'm not in the habit of taking in vagabonds.

0:0 - And yet - a notion born in lonely hours - come ebb, come flow, come all that is beyond the breadth of our dominion: be a moon unto yourself.
uid: 064cf9c8-2a87-40d0-a49d-50b80e9dfab2

Synopsis:

0:0 - *In the candlelight, Zevlor might almost be sleeping. But his empty eyes stare, his lips slack around a curl of parchment, poking through like a yellowed tongue.*

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Camp\Campfire_Moments\CAMP_OrinAbduction_CFM_Yenna.lsj
Synopsis:
When no valid companion for abduction is available, Orin insteadbducts Yenna - a beggar child who previously greeted players when they entered Wyrm’s Crossing, and who subsequently keeps appearing in their camp. Appearing as Yenna, Orin will try to get the player to drink a poisoned soup, before revealing herself. She tells the player that the real Yenna is in the Bhaal Temple, and gives them an ultimatum about killing Gortash and retrieving the Netherstone. If they do this, then she will not kill Yenna, and will duel the player instead.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Camp\Campfire_Moments\CAMP_OrinAbduction_CFM_Minthara.lsj
Synopsis:
The first longrest in Undercity, Orin will abduct one of the players companion. (Lae’zel, Halsin, Gale or Minthara). Based on the players approval rating with them. (Friend, Good Friend and Romance) Highest approval will be the highest priority. She will appear in camp impersonating her abducted victim and toy with the players. Shortly after, she grows tire of the game and reveals herself. And gives her ultimatum - Kill Gortash and retrieve his Netherstone - and bring it to her at her Bhaal Temple. Or the abducted companion dies. She will then teleport away.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Camp\Campfire_Moments\CAMP_OrinAbduction_CFM_Laezel.lsj
Synopsis:
The first longrest in Lower City, Orin will abduct one of the players companion. (Lae’zel, Halsin, Gale or Minthara). Based on the players approval rating with them. (Friend, Good Friend and Romance) Highest approval will be the highest priority. She will appear in camp impersonating her abducted victim and toy with the players. Shortly after, she grows tire of the game and reveals herself. And gives her ultimatum - Kill Gortash and retrieve his Netherstone - and bring it to her at her Bhaal Temple. Or the abducted companion dies. She will then teleport away.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Camp\Campfire_Moments\CAMP_OrinAbduction_CFM_Gale.lsj
Synopsis:
The first longrest in Undercity, Orin will abduct one of the players companion. (Lae’zel, Halsin, Gale or Minthara). Based on the players approval rating with them. (Friend, Good Friend and Romance) Highest approval will be the highest priority. She will appear in camp impersonating her abducted victim and toy with the players. Shortly after, she grows tire of the game and reveals herself. And gives her ultimatum - Kill Gortash and retrieve his Netherstone - and bring it to her at her Bhaal Temple. Or the abducted companion dies. She will then teleport away.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Camp\Campfire_Moments\CAMP_MinscJaheiraReunion_CFM.lsj
Synopsis:
After Minsc is rescued from the Absolute's domination, he and Jaheira have a brief confrontation at camp. They were the first to discover the cult, and Jaheira believes they might have ended the threat that night if Minsc had not charged in and been captured. The player can agree with Jaheira, or offer a counterpoint - that Minsc only did what he thought was right, and it set the course of events that eventually led you all to join forces.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Camp\Campfire_Moments\CAMP_Laezel_ROM_SD_Romance2_WokenUpByLaezel.lsj
Synopsis:
Laezel wakes you up in the middle of the night, making it seem at first like she wants sex. Instead, she's looking for a way to convince herself that her feelings towards you are justified and you deserve them. She challenges you to single combat. If the player refuses the duel, the romance with Laezel is ended here. If the players accept, they fight in gameplay and regardless of who wins, a sex scene starts afterwards, branching depending on the outcome.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Camp\Campfire_Moments\CAMP_Laezel_ROM_Romance3_MorningIVB.lsj
Synopsis:
To either the mockery or complete surprise of other gith, Lae’zel now is reconciling the fact she essentially has a relationship with the player going on. She might pretend that it isn’t, call it something else, furiously deny that it is anything like what the humans have… but call it what you will, the hallmarks are unmistakable, and she will eventually admit that she wants this more than anything else. Player can put the idea of Laezel abandoning her duties after the Tadpole problem is over and running away together. This replaces her generic outcast ending with the romance ending. Player can still choose the Vlaakith or Orpheus ending at the end, but also have an option to choose the Romance enging.

Cinematic: Fade to black. (Note: The following descriptions of how this encounter happens are fluid; intuitions of the actors should take precedence. The described physical actions are a jumping off point rather than an end goal.) This scene starts slowly. For all her talk, Karlach is a luxuriator, one who is fully aware how much work a simple touch can do. She approaches the player and places a hand on the small of their back, drawing them close. She puts her face in the player's neck and breathes in their scent, then kisses up their neck, to jaw bone, and across to mouth. She pauses to look deeply in the player's eyes, and smiles. Taking their face in her hand, she kisses them deeply. After a moment she begins tracing her hands from their ribs to their back, running a hand down their back to their ass, and holds their cheek/chin with the other hand. As the kissing gets more intense, Karlach starts to gain momentum. If avatar is female she might part avatar's legs with her knee and intiate some sexy grinding while continuing to kiss the player, one hand on player's hip. If avatar is male, she might collapse to the ground, player cross-legged, herself straddling player, and reach down with one hand to stroke the player. _Things escalate from there_ ---- Karlach has not been able to be intimate with anyone for 10 years, so for her, sexually, a little goes a long way. A caress is enough to get her engine well and truly roaring, and sexual contact itself will be an experience of pure bliss. Karlach lingers on touches, on deep kissing, on a sense of sexual abundance and guilelessness that allows her to achieve creative flow within a sexual context. Slowness, luxuriousness, and sensuality are the name of the game. Karalch is sexually powerful and confident - dominant energy but vanilla, ii.e. she would not engage in biting, choking, restraint, etc. However, she confidently maneuvers the player into her desired positions (in which she would flow between a more active and passive role without rigidity) and has no difficulty acting on her sexual intuitions. She is a very congruent person who experiences sexual flow state-- lost in the moment, fully engaged in sensations, enjoying the pure physical joy of it all.

For all her talk, Karlach is a luxuriator, one who is fully aware how much work a simple touch can do. She approaches the player and places a hand on the small of their back, drawing them close. She puts her face in the player's neck and breathes in their scent, then kisses up their neck, to jaw bone, and across to mouth. She pauses to look deeply in the player's eyes, and smiles. Taking their face in her hand, she kisses them deeply. After a moment she begins tracing her hands from their ribs to their back, running a hand down their back to their ass, and holds their cheek/chin with the other hand. As the kissing gets more intense, Karlach starts to gain momentum. If avatar is female she might part avatar's legs with her knee and intiate some sexy grinding while continuing to kiss the player, one hand on player's hip. If avatar is male, she might collapse to the ground, player cross-legged, herself straddling player, and reach down with one hand to stroke the player. _Things escalate from there_ ---- Karlach has not been able to be intimate with anyone for 10 years, so for her, sexually, a little goes a long way. A caress is enough to get her engine well and truly roaring, and sexual contact itself will be an experience of pure bliss. Karlach lingers on touches, on deep kissing, on a sense of sexual abundance and guilelessness that allows her to achieve creative flow within a sexual context. Slowness, luxuriousness, and sensuality are the name of the game. Karalch is sexually powerful and confident - dominant energy but vanilla, ii.e. she would not engage in biting, choking, restraint, etc. However, she confidently maneuvers the player into her desired positions (in which she would flow between a more active and passive role without rigidity) and has no difficulty acting on her sexual intuitions. She is a very congruent person who experiences sexual flow state-- lost in the moment, fully engaged in sensations, enjoying the pure physical joy of it all.

> *The oath you awoke with is some faded instinct. What does it even stand for?*

> *The rages in your heart arise as an ancient instinct - your skill in the fray is but a long-lost muscle memory.*
> *Though you know how to call to order, hold a line and wield a blade, you are doing so out of habit and a forgotten instinct.*
> *The worship of your God feels an ancient fool's errand you are only following out of habit. When you call to the skies, there is no answer.*
> *You are fortunate your sorceries come from your instincts and not your mangled head.*
> *Whatever deal you made with your patron still stands, but they are in your magics, not in your mind.*

Synopsis:
In this scene, a dragonborn bard, Quil Grootslang arrives unannounced at the player's camp. The player can tell them to leave or let them stay, but in either case in the next dialogue Quil will be dead.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Camp\Campfire_Moments\CAMP_DarkUrge_MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives.lsj
Synopsis:
In this scene, Alfira arrives unannounced at the player's camp. Depending on the grove, she either 1) asks the player if she can join their camp 2) be mad at the player for upsetting her in the grove and ask to spend the night (she got lost and needs shelter) or 3) if the player has missed the grove will ask the player to come help her friends the tieflings. In all instances, when the player and Alfira go to sleep, the player will awaken to find blood on their hands and Alfira's dead body next to her. They will have killed Alfira in their sleep. This is a scene specific to the Dark Urge custom origin.

0:0 - I fled Elturel along with dozens of others. We're in a grove nearby - things... are bad. Real bad.
uid: 04d4356b-0411-0f6d-92fa-3133f8804445

> null

Synopsis:
Jaheira and Minsc confront the Dark Urge about their recent revelation they are a Bhaalspawn. Depending on how much the player has given into Bhaal, they are either more sympathetic, or almost hostile. But either way, they are supportive and want to use their knowledge of fighting alongside Bhaalspawn in the past to convince you that you can do good

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Camp\Campfire_Moments\CAMP_DangerousBook_IVB_CFM_Astarion.lsj
Synopsis:
After giving Astarion the Tome of Thayan Necromancy, he begins to study it at camp to learn its secrets. He's frustrated by the voices of the spirits contained within the book, which are stopping him from accessing the secrets he's sure it contains. If he pushes the spirits too far, they'll respond with force - tearing at him with spectral hands. As you discuss the book with Astarion, his tone is on edge - nearly obsessive about discovering what's in the book. He won't part with it, even if he can't read it right now.

Synopsis:
You find Astarion shirtless, tracing the scars on his back with his fingers, trying to read what they say through touch. Initially startled and a little embarrassed, he'll open up to anyone he thinks he can trust. An intimate moment, where he'll let characters with a high approval rating try to read what his scars say, or at least trace them into the dirt for him to read.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Camp\Campfire_Moments\CAMP_AstarionHunger_IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice.lsj
Synopsis:
Astarion wakes up from a terrifying dream of his old master. His master had forbidden him to drink humanoid blood, but his master wasn't there... Astarion looks at the sleeping companions and considers biting one of them. If he does, he rolls a stealth check. If he succeeds, he sucks their blood (he can stop or decide to drain them dry). If he fails they wake up, and have to be convinced not to leave him.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Camp\Campfire_Moments\CAMP_AstarionHunger_SCO_Companion.lsj
Synopsis:
You wake up and find Astarion hunching over you, fangs bared. You fight him off. Caught off guard, he's alarmed and worried that you're going to kill him. He tries to be charming, explaining that he's too weak without blood. If you push back against his excuses he gets frustrated - he tries to bargain with you. If you agree to let him bite you, he's thrilled. He feels in control again. After drinking, he feels invigorated and cocky.

Synopsis:
Character wakes up in the morning after a terrible night's sleep. They're weak, woozy, and aching. They don't realise that Astarion secretly drank their blood last night and they slept through the whole thing.

0:0 - So much for the restorative qualities of sleep. I feel positively wretched.
